column4: just install openssh-server and port forward port 22 TCP and you can connect to it
are you using a router?
i'd also have the server using static IP so DHCP lease expiration doesn't mess with the link
makes life easier :)
you can also install the DUC client on the server if its on 24/7
try using tab to complete nics
yeah, I was being lazy. :/
its an extra single key,.....
install lm-sensors and it should install what you need

hm, same situation. ./configure yells at libpeas
what are you compiling?

precise
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:alexmurray/indicator-sensors; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install indicator-sensors
bit easier
can you give me a .. hint.. on how to even come to that conclusion
duckduckgo has a ppa search bang, or you can use: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+ppas
duckduckgo has:   !ppa indicator-sensors     and it will search the launchpad PPAs
the actual problem was.. libpeas-1.0 wasnt good enough, because libpeas-dev worked
nice
the bang syntax for searching PPAs is dead handy
